content.rendered:
NYU Data Services and the Science & Engineering Libraries of NYU are hosting a Workshop on Reproducible Research Practices by the Center for Open Science on November 14th from 10:15am-12pm. Register now using the link at the bottom of this message!

Workshop on Reproducible Research Practices

Have you heard about the reproducibility crisis in science (ex. in AAAS and Economist)? Do you worry about false positive results? Or ever wondered how you could increase the reproducibility of your own work? Join us for a workshop on reproducible research, hosted by the Center for Open Science. Learn about factors that contribute to the reproducibility crisis, and techniques and tools you can incorporate into your workflow to increase the openness and reproducibility of your work.

Date: Friday, November 14th
Time: 10:15am – 12:00pm
Location: AFC East Room, Avery Fisher Center, Bobst Library
Please RVSP as space is limited.

Questions? Contact Data Services at data.services@nyu.edu.
